items.sentence: Tom drove to the supermarket to buy some milk and eggs.
No matter what you say, I\'m convinced that I\'m right.
I might be at home this evening, but I\'m not sure yet.
I now live in Boston, but I\'m originally from Chicago.
I read the article about you in yesterday\'s newspaper.
Tom couldn\'t believe that he had just won the lottery.
Tom couldn\'t believe that no one laughed at his jokes.
Tom couldn\'t fall asleep so he got up and took a walk.
Tom couldn\'t get Mary to tell him why she was unhappy.
Tom couldn\'t get to sleep till after three last night.
Tom couldn\'t go to the concert because he had to work.
She needed some money to buy something to feed her dog.
She spends more time thinking about work than doing it.
It wasn\'t long before Tom got tired and went to sleep.
My high school French teacher wasn\'t a native speaker.
She asked him some questions, but he refused to answer.
She concealed the fact that she used to be a salesgirl.
Thank you very much for sending me such a nice present.
Tom apologized to Mary for his son\'s impolite remarks.
I saw something strange on my way to work this morning.
